critique: The document is an executive order imposing sanctions on Syria due to the government's violence against its people. It blocks property and interests of the Syrian government and certain individuals, prohibits new investment in Syria, restricts trade and financial transactions, and prevents donations to blocked individuals. The order aims to address the national emergency declared in previous executive orders related to Syria. It grants the Secretary of the Treasury authority to implement the order and doesn't create any enforceable rights against the United States.
